revised_title: The Influence of Atmospheric and Temperature Changes on the Strength of Fused Silica
tldr: This study investigates the effects of atmospheric and temperature changes on the strength of fused silica fibers. The authors found that the strength of silica is highly dependent on testing conditions and can vary from 280 to 1500 N. They also discovered that factors such as heat treatment, specimen preparation, and the surrounding atmosphere significantly impact the strength of the material.
